title: Manchester City plotting world-record Dele Alli bid? Monday's transfer gossip
text:
Tottenham's Dele Alli is reportedly on Manchester City's wish list (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester City are reportedly plotting a world-record bid for Dele Alli. 
The Express say City have joined Real Madrid and PSG in the bid to land Tottenham's young England star. 
It is claimed Spurs will reject any bids for the former MK Dons attacker but their stance will be tested if the bidding surpasses the £89million paid for Paul Pogba by Manchester United. 
Pep Guardiola is said to be keen on Alli as he wants to rebuild his ageing City squad. 
Here are the rest of the stories doing the rounds: Monday's transfer stories from the Mirror 
Alexis Sanchez is involved in a transfer tug-of-war between Paris Saint-Germain and Juventus. Italian champions Juventus believe they have a strong chance of signing the Arsenal striker who has only got 18 months left on his current contract. The Gunners are fearful Sanchez will not sign a new deal after offering him a contract worth £180,000-a-week, which is still short of his demands. PSG have also sounded out his representatives and believe they can tempt Sanchez to France. Alexis Sanchez is on the radars of PSG and Juventus (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has told Sergio Aguero he wants him to stay but admits he has no idea where the striker will be next season. Guardiola insists the Argentine is key to his plans at the Blues, despite benching him for the last two Premier League games. Aguero has hinted he could go at the end of the season and Guardiola has added to the uncertainty over his future by saying he is unsure about him long-term. 
Chelsea target Tiemoue Bakayoko is understood to have rejected a contract extension at Monaco. The 22-year-old defensive midfielder is highly rated and has been chased by a number of teams, including both Manchester clubs. Other news stories from Monday's Mirror 
EXCLUSIVE - Brazil and Barcelona great Ronaldinho claims new Manchester City darling Gabriel Jesus can take over from Lionel Messi as the world’s best footballer. 
Alex McLeish has revealed he would be open to a return to Rangers. Graeme Murty was in charge for Sunday's Scottish Cup win over Morton but former boss McLeish, who was at Ibrox in a punditry role, admitted he would find it difficult to turn down the opportunity to succeed Mark Warburton if it came up. 
Arsene Wenger has admitted off-form Mesut Ozil is suffering from a crisis of confidence ahead of Arsenal’s Champions League showdown with Bayern Munich in Germany on Wednesday. Arsene Wenger says Mesut Ozil is suffering a crisis of confidence (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty) 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic revealed how his breakfast chats with Anthony Martial helped the young striker rediscover his best form after a difficult season under sceptical new boss Jose Mourinho. 
Sadio Mane's agent has rejected claims his client turned down a move from Southampton to Tottenham in the summer, joining Liverpool instead, due to his wage demands. News stories from other newspapers and websites 
Napoli defender Faouzi Ghoulam has spoken to Chelsea about a transfer in the summer when he becomes a free agent. (Express) 
Jose Mourinho sold Juan Mata at Chelsea in 2014 but never intended on doing the same at Manchester United because he wants the Red Devils to play in a different way to how he wanted the Blues to play.
